content: around 12 stitches eyes put your safety eyes in now row 19 *decrease single_crochet 1* repeat around 8 stitches put a bit more stuffing in the elephant and shape so it has a rounded/dome head row 20-26 single_crochet 8 8 stitches these row make the trunk it just needs light stuffing you can use a pen or the butt of your crochet hook to push a little stuffing down the trunk note if you put too much stuffing up the front end the elephant can become off balance this is quite a small toy and as the trunk points out a fair way it can be too heavy and cause the elephant to tip forward aim for medium stuffing at the back and lighter stuffing up the front bind cut the yarn and bind off using a needle thread around the inside stitches of the remaining 8 single_crochet stitches not the outside stitches like usual and pull closed thread that yarn back into the trunk to hide it pull gently on this thread until the end of the trunk is flush/flat with the unused outside stitches shape give the ears a good tug and curl them around to the front curve the elephant trunk so it points upwards use your needle to push some extra stuffing up to the top of the head if required criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-elephant criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-elephant
